translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

The two letters from Your Lordship dated the 28th and 30th of last month were presented to the government, and from their content it was well understood, approving the measures taken by Your Lordship.

And regarding the last part of your letter, in which you refer to the woman indicated as dangerous to the tranquility of this department, seeing that she in some way favored the ingress of the enemy: the government orders that, after Your Lordship

The attached letter, I beseech Your Lordship

God keep Your Lordship  
Secretary of War Affairs in Caçapava, May 14, 1840  
Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães.  
Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre

Letter from the Most Excellent, May 14, received on the 28th of the same month, about the parts I gave of the enemy, and the woman indicated as enemy, etc., etc.
